How Filters Are Applied to the Report

Knowing how to apply filters to get the result you expect is a critical aspect of BIQ. Before you read any other section of this manual, make sure that you understand these two concepts completely:

17. Within a dimension, filter values that you select will be joined by an OR clause in your report definition.

18. Across different dimensions, filter values you select will be joined by an AND clause

An example will help clarify:

The report definition specified here will be read by BIQ as, “Find all shipments to either Chicago OR Charlotte where the product type was ‘Beverages’.

Algebraically, we could represent this as:

 (Chicago OR Charlotte) AND Beverages.

If we added ‘Breads & Rolls’ as another product filter, we would then have:

(Chicago OR Charlotte) AND (Beverages OR Breads & Rolls)

As you begin working in BIQ more and more, this will become second nature. However, it is important to understand this at the outset so that you can anticipate how the application will interpret your instructions.
